sentence.Network_en: As a dramatist I hate to moralize.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为一名剧作家，我憎恨说教。

sentence.Network_en: My dear boy, you are really beginning to moralize.
sentence.Network_cn: 好孩子, 你真是开始说教啦.

sentence.Network_en: But he did not moralize long.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是,他对这些大道理想得并不长久.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'explain the moral meaning of'): from French moraliser or medieval Latin moralizare, from late Latin moralis (see moral)

entry.tran: 进行训诫，进行说教，教化
entry.def: If you say that someone is moralizing, you are critical of them for telling people what they think is right or wrong, especially when they have not been asked their opinion.

example.ex: As a dramatist I hate to moralize...
example.tran: 作为一名剧作家，我憎恨说教。

example.ex: Society in general moralized about 'loose women'.
example.tran: 社会通常会对那些“浪荡女子”指指点点。

means.word_mean: 2. speak as if delivering a sermon; express moral judgements;

auth_sentence.content: Medieval...mythographers normally moralize Narcissus as the man who wastes himself in pursuing worldly goods.

stems_affixes.word_buile: non非+moral[adj.道德[上]的,精神上的 n.寓意,教育意义]→adj.与道德无关的
mor道德+al……的→adj.道德[上]的,精神上的 n.寓意,教育意义
mor道德+es表示复数→n.风俗习惯,道德观念
mor道德+al……的→adj.道德[上]的,精神上的 n.寓意,教育意义
mor道德+ale→[一群人]有道德精神→士气
